Method Detail

lockWifiForMulticast

public static void lockWifiForMulticast(Context context,
                                        boolean lockWifi)
                                 throws Types.AirFlingerException
Locks the device's WiFi to accept multicast transmissions.

Note: It is advised to lock the WiFi for multicast and request a searchDevices command when opening a device selection screen, and to release the WiFi multicast lock when leaving the device selection screen. This practice will enable new devices to be added to the list even after the user opens the selection screen. Releasing the lock is intended to save battery power.

Parameters:
context - A Context object
lockWifi - Specifies whether to lock or release the multicast lock
Throws:
Types.AirFlingerException

getLocalMedia

public static boolean getLocalMedia(Activity activity,
                                    MediaObject.MediaObjectType type,
                                    boolean prettyView,
                                    LocalMediaProvider.ILocalMediaProviderCallback cb)
Gets a media browser object containing all local media items of the requested type.

Parameters:
activity - An activity object
type - The type of the media items to browse
prettyView - If sets to true, the media browser will automatically drill down directories that contain only one sub-directory with no media items
cb - The callback that will be invoked with the media provider.
Returns:
false if invocation failed, true if succeeded. LocalMediaProvider will be returned via the asynchronous callback.
See Also:
LocalMediaProvider

setWebViewClient

public static void setWebViewClient(Activity activity,
                                    WebView webView,
                                    WebViewClient webViewClient,
                                    IWebViewMediaDelegate mediaDelegate)
                             throws Types.AirFlingerException
Sets a WebViewClient to a WebView and monitors video player events. Use this method instead of a call to webView.setWebViewClient(webViewClient). All your WebViewClient functions will be invoked, but the SDK will monitor the video player on the page and will send updates through mediaDelegate.

Note: For mediaDelegate you can extend AFWebViewMediaDelegate and override only the desired methods.

Parameters:
activity - The activity object
webView - The WebView object in your activity
webViewClient - Optional - object to receive WebView callback. If null, a default WebViewClient will be created
mediaDelegate - Optional - object to receive video element events. Can be null
Throws:
Types.AirFlingerException
